title: How to get free eBooks - Quora

response.answer_text: You could buy a Kindle Unlimited subscription. That turns a big chunk of Amazon into a lending library. There are a pile of email subscriptions you can look at BookRunes - Daily email & web site listing free books (BookRunes | Free Kindle Books) Freebooksy - Daily email & web site listing free books (Freebooksy - Free Kindle Books, Nook Books, Apple Books and Kobo Books Hand-Selected Daily. Pick your favorite genre, and start reading free kindle books.) BookBub - Daily email & web site listing free & cheap books (Great deals on bestsellers you'll love) Bookrebel - Daily email & web site listing free & cheap books (Book Rebel) eBookSoda - Daily email & web site listing free & cheap books (ebook deals tailored to your taste.) instafreebie - Biweekly email & web site listing free & cheap books (Instafreebie) All of them are legal, they look at Amazon and various other providers for either free or heavily discounted books.

Amazon have a lot of free books. There is Bookbub which has free books. Also I believe books may be available from a local library. I expect there are many other sources where free books are available it may be according to which part of the world in which you live.
Hi. I use http://www.freebookspot for years. It has about 0.5M books at the moment. There are 49 categories from Mathematics to Romance Novels. No registration is needed.
